DOC.brief_title: Strength Training Using Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation For Children With Cerebral Palsy
DOC.detailed_description: The overall goal study determine use high-intensity , short-duration , intermittent neuromuscular electrical stimulation ( NMES ) well volitional exercise increase quadriceps femoris triceps surae force-generating potential gross motor function child cerebral palsy . This study consist randomize controlled trial effect NMES apply quadriceps femoris triceps surae compare effect volitional isometric exercise non-exercising control group . This project assess ability NMES increase muscle force generate ability , mechanism behind change force generate ability , effect train spatiotemporal parameter gait gross motor function child cerebral palsy . Subjects NMES group implant percutaneous electrode medial lateral head gastrocnemius quadriceps ( 3 electrode low extremity , implant bilaterally ) . During intervention phase , subject undergo 15 electrically-elicited contraction implant muscle group three times/week ( home ) , position exercise board maintain good alignment facilitate isometric contraction . Subjects volitional group perform 15 isometric contraction muscle group ( quadriceps , triceps surae ) , position exercise board . The non-exercise control group continue typical activity , intervention administer . Subjects assess baseline , 6 week intervention , 12 week intervention ( point intervention withdrawn ) , follow-up assessment 12 week withdrawal intervention .
